page.title: 02An archaeological dig
page.content: This summer a{dig}was organised by Birmingham University behind{Castle {Farm.}Five grey caravans plus some brightly coloured tents housed the archaeologists. A{dozen trenches}soon appeared.Most of the digging was{pick, shovel and {mattock}work,with a plasterer's trowel used to clean up the trench and reveal the various layers, each of which was carefully labelled and numbered. Supervisors with thick{site files peered at the layers making detailed notes and discussing the significance of each emerging feature. By each trench was a tray which filled with{pottery fragments}and motley{animal bones}as the day proceeded, to be taken away for washing by volunteer helpers who included many interested children. These finds helped to date the layers.
